cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: moving very slowly north, then turning north-northeast toward the Alabama/Florida Panhandle coast before tracking inland across Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Alabama coast between Mobile, AL and Pensacola, FL

weather_observation.warning_coast: Bay St. Louis, MS westward to Grand Isle, LA (includes New Orleans area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts (39–50 mph) possible Tuesday night through Wednesday as the circulation passes east of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible on Lake Pontchartrain and tidal lakes; 1–3 ft along the lower Mississippi Delta near New Orleans.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause urban and low-lying area flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and minor river rises in surrounding waterways.
